title.narrative: ADOLESCENTS MULTISECTOR COORDINATION

description.narrative: By 2020, multisector coordination on adolescent-sensitive issues, evidence-based policies and strategies, with a focus on HIV/AIDS, are in place, which contributes to Adolescents And Hiv/Aids, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Cross-Sectoral Adolescent Development, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Fast-Track The End Of Hiv/Aids, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, adolescents, particularly girls, their families and communities adopt key healthy and protective behaviours and are engaged in the development process.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, multisector coordination on adolescent-sensitive issues, evidence-based policies and strategies, with a focus on HIV/AIDS,are in place

description.narrative: In 2021, UNICEF continued supporting both the government-led and UN-led multi-sectoral coordination mechanisms which included the Committee for Support to the Development of Young and Adolescent People (CIADAJ),;Rapariga;Biz Steering Committee,;Youth Partners Group, and others, to ensure collaboration and harmonization of methods addressing Adolescent Sexual and Reproductive Health (ASRH), HIV prevention, Child Marriage and Violence Against Children (VAC), whilst continuing to encourage adolescent engagement in research, policy making and strategy development. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:23/12/2021

actual.value: 2020:Adolescent SiTAN disseminated by adolescent themselves in several public fora to influence programming such as VAC in Schools reporting mechanism planning meeting and UNICEF Annual Review. In 2020, adolescents will present at National PGB Meeting.
